019package org.jgrapes.webconsole.base;
020
021import java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue;
022import java.lang.ref.WeakReference;
023import java.time.Duration;
024import java.time.Instant;
025import java.util.Collections;
026import java.util.HashSet;
027import java.util.Locale;
028import java.util.Map;
029import java.util.Optional;
030import java.util.Set;
031import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
032import java.util.function.Supplier;
033import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
035import org.jgrapes.core.Components.Timer;
036import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Subchannel;
038import org.jgrapes.http.Session;
039import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel;
040import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel.DefaultIOSubchannel;
041import org.jgrapes.io.events.Closed;
042import org.jgrapes.io.util.LinkedIOSubchannel;
043
044/**
045 * The server side representation of a window in the browser 
046 * that displays a console page (a console connection). An instance 
047 * is created when a new console window opens the WebSocket 
048 * connection to the server for the first time. If the 
049 * connection between the browser and the server is lost
050 * (e.g. due to temporary network failure), the console code in 
051 * the browser tries to establish a new WebSocket connection 
052 * to the same, already existing {@link ConsoleConnection}. 
053 * The {@link ConsoleConnection} object is thus independent 
054 * of the WebSocket connection that handles the actual transfer 
055 * of notifications.
056 * 
057 * ![WebConsole Connection](ConsoleConnection.svg)
058 * 
059 * To allow reconnection and because there is no reliable way 
060 * to be notified when a window in a browser closes, {@link Closed} 
061 * events from the network are ignored and {@link ConsoleConnection}s 
062 * remain in an open state as long as they are in use. Only if no 
063 * data is received (i.e. {@link #refresh()} isn't called) for the 
064 * time span configured with
065 * {@link ConsoleWeblet#setConnectionNetworkTimeout}
066 * a {@link Closed} event is fired on the channel and the console 
067 * connection is closed. (Method {@link #isConnected()} can be used 
068 * to check the connection state.)
069 * In order to keep the console connection in an open state while
070 * the connection is inactive, i.e. no data is sent due to user activity,
071 * the SPA automatically generates refresh messages as configured
072 * with {@link ConsoleWeblet#setConnectionRefreshInterval(Duration)}. 
073 * 
074 * {@link ConsoleConnection} implements the {@link IOSubchannel}
075 * interface. This allows the instances to be used as channels
076 * for exchanging console connection scoped events with the 
077 * {@link WebConsole} component. The upstream channel
078 * (see {@link #upstreamChannel()}) is the channel of the
079 * WebSocket. It may be unavailable if the WebSocket connection has
080 * been interrupted and not (yet) re-established.
081 * The {@link IOSubchannel}'s response {@link EventPipeline} 
082 * must be used to send events (responses) to the console connection 
083 * in the browser. No other event pipeline may be used for 
084 * this purpose, else messages will interleave.
085 * 
086 * To avoid having too many open WebSockets with inactive console
087 * connections, a maximum inactivity time can be configured with 
088 * {@link ConsoleWeblet#setConnectionInactivityTimeout(Duration)}.
089 * The SPA always checks if the time since the last user activity 
090 * has reached or exceeded the configured limit before sending the 
091 * next refresh message. In case it has, the SPA stops sending 
092 * refresh messages and displays a "suspended" dialog to the user.
093 * 
094 * When the user chooses to resume, a new WebSocket is opened by the
095 * SPA. If the {@link Session} used before the idle timeout is 
096 * still available (hasn't reached its idle timeout or absolute timeout)
097 * and refers to a {@link ConsoleConnection} not yet closed, then this
098 * {@link ConsoleConnection} is reused, else the SPA is reloaded.
099 * 
100 * As a convenience, the {@link ConsoleConnection} provides
101 * direct access to the browser session, which can 
102 * usually only be obtained from the HTTP event or WebSocket
103 * channel by looking for an association of type {@link Session}.
104 * 
105 * @startuml ConsoleConnection.svg
106 * class ConsoleConnection {
107 *  -{static}Map<String,ConsoleConnection> consoleConnections
108 *  +{static}findOrCreate(String consoleConnectionId, Manager component): ConsoleConnection
109 *  +setTimeout(timeout: long): ConsoleConnection
110 *  +refresh(): void
111 *  +setUpstreamChannel(IOSubchannel upstreamChannel): ConsoleConnection
112 *  +setSessionSupplier(Session sessionSupplier): ConsoleConnection
113 *  +upstreamChannel(): Optional<IOSubchannel>
114 *  +consoleConnectionId(): String
115 *  +session(): Optional<Session>
116 *  +locale(): Locale
117 *  +setLocale(Locale locale): void
118 * }
119 * 
120 * interface IOSubchannel {
121 * }
122 * 
123 * IOSubchannel <|.. ConsoleConnection
124 * 
125 * ConsoleConnection "1" *-- "*" ConsoleConnection : maintains
126 * 
127 * package org.jgrapes.http {
128 *     class Session
129 * }
130 * 
131 * ConsoleConnection "*" -up-> "1" Session: browser session
132 * @enduml
133 */
134@SuppressWarnings("PMD.LinguisticNaming")
135public final class ConsoleConnection extends DefaultIOSubchannel {
136
137    private static Map<String, WeakReference<ConsoleConnection>> connections
138        = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
139    private static ReferenceQueue<ConsoleConnection> unusedConnections
140        = new ReferenceQueue<>();
141
142    private String connectionId;
143    private final WebConsole console;
144    private final Set<Locale> supportedLocales;
145    private Locale locale;
146    private long timeout;
147    private final Timer timeoutTimer;
148    private boolean active = true;
149    private boolean connected = true;
150    private Supplier<Optional<Session>> sessionSupplier;
151    private IOSubchannel upstreamChannel;
152
153    /**
154     * Weak reference to session.
155     */
156    private static class ConnectionReference
157            extends WeakReference<ConsoleConnection> {
158
159        private final String id;
160
161        /**
162         * Instantiates a new session reference.
163         *
164         * @param referent the referent
165         */
166        public ConnectionReference(ConsoleConnection referent) {
167            super(referent, unusedConnections);
168            id = referent.consoleConnectionId();
169        }
170    }
171
172    private static void cleanUnused() {
173        while (true) {
174            ConnectionReference unused
175                = (ConnectionReference) unusedConnections.poll();
176            if (unused == null) {
177                break;
178            }
179            connections.remove(unused.id);
180        }
181    }
182
183    /**
184     * Lookup the console connection (the channel)
185     * for the given console connection id.
186     * 
187     * @param connectionId the console connection id
188     * @return the channel
189     */
190    /* default */ static Optional<ConsoleConnection>
191            lookup(String connectionId) {
192        cleanUnused();
193        return Optional.ofNullable(connections.get(connectionId))
194            .flatMap(ref -> Optional.ofNullable(ref.get()));
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Return all connections that belong to the given console as a new
199     * unmodifiable set.
200     *
201     * @param console the console
202     * @return the sets the
203     */
204    public static Set<ConsoleConnection> byConsole(WebConsole console) {
205        cleanUnused();
206        Set<ConsoleConnection> result = new HashSet<>();
207        for (WeakReference<ConsoleConnection> psr : connections.values()) {
208            ConsoleConnection psess = psr.get();
209            if (psess != null && psess.console != null
210                && psess.console.equals(console)) {
211                result.add(psess);
212            }
213        }
214        return Collections.unmodifiableSet(result);
215    }
216
217    /**
218     * Lookup (and create if not found) the console connection
219     * for the given console connection id.
220     *
221     * @param connectionId the connection id
222     * @param console the console that this connection belongs to
223     * class' constructor if a new channel is created, usually 
224     * the console
225     * @param supportedLocales the locales supported by the console
226     * @param timeout the console connection timeout in milli seconds
227     * @return the channel
228     */
229    /* default */ static ConsoleConnection lookupOrCreate(
230            String connectionId, WebConsole console,
231            Set<Locale> supportedLocales, long timeout) {
232        cleanUnused();
233        return connections.computeIfAbsent(connectionId,
234            psi -> new ConnectionReference(new ConsoleConnection(
235                console, supportedLocales, connectionId, timeout)))
236            .get();
237    }
238
239    /**
240     * Replace the id of the console connection with the new id.
241     *
242     * @param newConnectionId the new console connection id
243     * @return the console connection
244     */
245    /* default */ ConsoleConnection replaceId(String newConnectionId) {
246        connections.remove(connectionId);
247        connectionId = newConnectionId;
248        connections.put(connectionId, new ConnectionReference(this));
249        connected = true;
250        return this;
251    }
252
253    private ConsoleConnection(WebConsole console, Set<Locale> supportedLocales,
254            String connectionId, long timeout) {
255        super(console.channel(), console.newEventPipeline());
256        this.console = console;
257        this.supportedLocales = supportedLocales;
258        this.connectionId = connectionId;
259        this.timeout = timeout;
260        timeoutTimer = Components.schedule(
261            tmr -> discard(), Duration.ofMillis(timeout));
262    }
263
264    /**
265     * Changes the timeout for this {@link ConsoleConnection} to the
266     * given value.
267     * 
268     * @param timeout the timeout in milli seconds
269     * @return the console connection for easy chaining
270     */
271    public ConsoleConnection setTimeout(long timeout) {
272        this.timeout = timeout;
273        timeoutTimer.reschedule(Duration.ofMillis(timeout));
274        return this;
275    }
276
277    /**
278     * Returns the time when this connection will expire.
279     *
280     * @return the instant
281     */
282    public Instant expiresAt() {
283        return timeoutTimer.scheduledFor();
284    }
285
286    /**
287     * Resets the {@link ConsoleConnection}'s timeout.
288     */
289    public void refresh() {
290        timeoutTimer.reschedule(Duration.ofMillis(timeout));
291    }
292
293    /**
294     * Discards this connection.
295     */
296    public void discard() {
297        connections.remove(connectionId);
298        connected = false;
299        active = false;
300        console.newEventPipeline().fire(new Closed(), this);
301    }
302
303    /**
304     * Checks if the console connection has become stale (inactive).
305     *
306     * @return true, if is stale
307     */
308    public boolean isStale() {
309        return !active;
310    }
311
312    /* default */ void disconnected() {
313        connected = false;
314    }
315
316    /**
317     * Checks if a network connection with the browser exists.
318     *
319     * @return true, if is connected
320     */
321    public boolean isConnected() {
322        return connected;
323    }
324
325    /**
326     * Provides access to the weblet's channel.
327     *
328     * @return the channel
329     */
330    public Channel webletChannel() {
331        return console.webletChannel();
332    }
333
334    /**
335     * Sets or updates the upstream channel. This method should only
336     * be invoked by the creator of the {@link ConsoleConnection}, by default
337     * the {@link ConsoleWeblet}.
338     * 
339     * @param upstreamChannel the upstream channel (WebSocket connection)
340     * @return the console connection for easy chaining
341     */
342    public ConsoleConnection setUpstreamChannel(IOSubchannel upstreamChannel) {
343        if (upstreamChannel == null) {
344            throw new IllegalArgumentException();
345        }
346        this.upstreamChannel = upstreamChannel;
347        return this;
348    }
349
350    /**
351     * Sets or updates associated browser session. This method should only
352     * be invoked by the creator of the {@link ConsoleConnection}, by default
353     * the {@link ConsoleWeblet}.
354     * 
355     * @param sessionSupplier the browser session supplier
356     * @return the console connection for easy chaining
357     */
358    public ConsoleConnection
359            setSessionSupplier(Supplier<Optional<Session>> sessionSupplier) {
360        this.sessionSupplier = sessionSupplier;
361        if (locale == null) {
362            locale = session().locale();
363        }
364        return this;
365    }
366
367    /**
368     * @return the upstream channel
369     */
370    public IOSubchannel upstreamChannel() {
371        return upstreamChannel;
372    }
373
374    /**
375     * The console connection id is used in the communication between the
376     * browser and the server. It is not guaranteed to remain the same
377     * over time, even if the console connection is maintained. To prevent
378     * wrong usage, its visibility is therefore set to package. 
379     * 
380     * @return the connectionId
381     */
382    /* default */ String consoleConnectionId() {
383        return connectionId;
384    }
385
386    /**
387     * @return the browser session
388     */
389    public Session session() {
390        return sessionSupplier.get().get();
391    }
392
393    /**
394     * Returns the supported locales.
395     *
396     * @return the set of locales supported by the console
397     */
398    public Set<Locale> supportedLocales() {
399        return supportedLocales;
400    }
401
402    /**
403     * Return the console connection's locale. The locale is initialized
404     * from the browser session's locale.
405     * 
406     * @return the locale
407     */
408    public Locale locale() {
409        return locale == null ? Locale.getDefault() : locale;
410    }
411
412    /**
413     * Sets the locale for this console connection.
414     *
415     * @param locale the locale
416     * @return the console connection
417     */
418    public ConsoleConnection setLocale(Locale locale) {
419        this.locale = locale;
420        return this;
421    }
422
423    /*
424     * (non-Javadoc)
425     * 
426     * @see java.lang.Object#toString()
427     */
428    @Override
429    public String toString() {
430        StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
431        builder.append(Subchannel.toString(this));
432        Optional.ofNullable(upstreamChannel).ifPresent(upstr -> builder.append(
433            LinkedIOSubchannel.upstreamToString(upstr)));
434        return builder.toString();
435    }
436
437}
